fields.headline: Yacrosoft news round-up
fields.bodyText: Google shares fall below $500 for first time in six months The price dropped below $500 (£254) for the first time in six months as investors grow concerned about increased competition from Microsoft's potential merger with Yahoo. Source: Guardian Murdoch puts price on premium Wall Street Journal web content Rupert Murdoch last night confirmed that parts of the online Wall Street Journal will remain subscription-based. Source: Guardian Google offers pact with Yahoo in effort to thwart Microsoft Search site also canvasses counter bidders for rival. Source: Guardian Murdoch rules out bid for Yahoo Rupert Murdoch has played down speculation that he is interested in launching a rival takeover bid for internet search engine Yahoo. Source: BBC What you all are missing about Google Google doesn't mind this deal going through at all. Google knows they will be able to outrun a 'Microhoo'. Source: Scobleizer The five stages of Yahoo's grief By rejecting Microsoft's initial foray back in February 2007, Yahoo may have only whet Microsoft's appetite, bought them a limited amount of time and lost them bargaining power. Source: New York Times DealBook Microsoft bid is better than stagnating, say Yahoo insiders For a company hobbled by cultural and management problems, a $44.6 billion hostile takeover bid from Microsoft may be just the kick in the pants it needs to fight Google. Source: CNet Microsoft hits back at Google Microsoft is threatening to fight back through the regulators if its ambitions were stymied by any partnership between the two. Source: FT Microsoft's acquisition of Yahoo - it's not that bad While it's not the ultimate happy ending, it does have some up sides. Source: TechCrunch Via: Del-icio.us
